title: At least 45 people killed in a crush of people at mass religious festival
description: At least 44 people have been killed in a crush at a mass religious gathering on Mount Meron in northern Israel, emergency responders say.

title: White House bans travel from India, starting May 4
description: CNN's Kaitlan Collins reports.

title: The great power race between the US and China is on. And Beijing is confident of winning
Ice Age fossil find turns Las Vegas couple's new pool into a dig site
description: Workers building a new swimming pool for a Las Vegas couple got a bit of a shock when they dug up a set of bones that are believed to date back to the Ice Age and may have been buried there for 14,000 years.

title: Fractures in the Republican Party are on full display
description: House Conference Chairwoman Rep. Liz Cheney is once again facing the ire of her colleagues and GOP voters, laying bare the ongoing and internal divisions within the GOP about how Republicans should move forward in the wake of former President Donald Trump.

title: Rep. Cheney asked if Trump should be prosecuted. Hear her answer
description: House Conference Chairwoman Rep. Liz Cheney is once again facing the ire of her colleagues and GOP voters after leaning in to greet President Joe Biden as he made his way down the aisle at his speech to a joint session of Congress. CNN's Manu Raju reports.

title: India doesn't want to shut down its economy again. It may get crushed anyway
Biden pushes infrastructure plan: We're behind the rest of the world
description: President Joe Biden spoke at the Amtrak 50th anniversary event about his $2.25 trillion infrastructure plan, which he says will create more jobs across the US and enable it to compete with other nations.

title: Soccer's social media blackout: 'When we come together, it's powerful'
description: It has been five weeks since Thierry Henry deleted his social media accounts and the former Arsenal forward has been through a range of emotions.

title: A pair of Lionel Messi's soccer boots auctioned for $173,000
description: A pair of Lionel Messi's boots have been sold for charity for $173,000, auction house Christie's said on Friday.

title: Men with badges tried to stop CNN reporter, but they weren't police
description: CNN's Kyung Lah examines the ongoing Republican election audit of the 2020 ballots from Arizona's largest county.

title: CDC reports most J&J vaccine side effects are 'nonserious'
description: A new review of Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine safety monitoring data finds that only 3% of reported reactions after receiving the vaccine are classified as serious -- and there have been a total of 17 incidents of severe blood clotting while also experiencing low blood platelet levels.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow's Goop Cruise is ready to set sail
description: Gwyneth Paltrow's Goop Cruise is finally going full steam ahead after its much-hyped debut was canceled thanks to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: BAFTA suspends 'Doctor Who' star over abuse allegations
description: BAFTA, the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, has suspended British actor and producer Noel Clarke following allegations of sexual misconduct.

title: People are ready to have sex again: Condom sales are surging
description: Condom sales have been in a slump during the pandemic as people sheltered at home and put their sex life on hold. But now, as more Americans are getting vaccinated and Covid-19 safety restrictions are loosening, condom makers are no longer having trouble getting their sales up.

title: Al Qaeda promises 'war on all fronts' against America as Biden pulls out of Afghanistan
description: This weekend marks the 10th anniversary since Osama Bin Laden, the mastermind of the September 11, 2001, attacks on the United States, was killed by US special-operations forces, Seal Team 6, inside his high-walled compound in the Pakistani military college city of Abbottabad.

title: Experts are divided on the new CDC mask guidance. Here's what they're saying.
description: New mask guidance from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention this week has divided experts and fueled a new debate about the best way to steer Americans out of the pandemic.

title: Americans' incomes zoomed higher at record speed in March
description: The economic recovery is underway and while there's still plenty of work to be done, new data on Americans' incomes shows the government's spending efforts are bearing fruit.

title: Morgan Wallen is a Billboard Music Awards finalist, but he won't be a part of the show
description: Morgan Wallen is a finalist in five categories at this year's Billboard Music Awards, but don't expect to see him at the show.

title: Washington Post: FBI warned Rudy Giuliani directly of Russian influence campaign
description: Rudy Giuliani was warned by the FBI in late 2019 that he was the target of a Russian influence operation intended to damage now-President Joe Biden in the 2020 election by spreading falsehoods, The Washington Post reported Thursday night.

title: Major Biden receives special training to prepare for new White House cat
description: Some Major news at the White House: Major Biden has made his return to 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue after training following two biting incidents, but he may soon have to adjust to another furry friend.

title: Biden says schools 'should probably all be open' in the fall
description: President Joe Biden said Friday that K-12 schools "should probably all be open" in the fall for in-person learning after more than a year of most of the country's kids facing the challenge of remote instruction due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: YouTubers to be deported from Bali following prank video
description: Two self-described influencers are to be deported from the Indonesian resort island of Bali after being jailed for creating a "prank" video of a painted-on face mask, an official said on Friday.

title: Instacart shoppers demand answers over alleged wrongfully deactivated accounts
description: For Rachael Freedman, shopping for on-demand grocery delivery startup Instacart felt like something of a dream job.

title: Halle Berry laughed at joke about her Oscar's hairstyle
description: Halle Berry definitely saw the conversation about her new bob at last Sunday's Academy Awards.

title: Europe's recession deepened in the first quarter but the recovery is underway
description: Europe fell deeper into recession in the first three months of the year, but the region's economy is already turning a corner and looks set to bounce back as coronavirus restrictions ease.

title: These TikTok stars built a VC firm backed by Anthony Scaramucci and the Winklevoss twins
description: Social media influencers have enormous power to set trends, create overnight sensations and broadly define what's cool. Josh Richards, a 19-year-old determined to be the world's first influencer billionaire, isn't shy about flexing that clout.

title: Ma'Khia Bryant to be remembered as a vibrant and bubbly girl at funeral
description: Ma'Khia Bryant loved styling her curly hair in front of her camera phone and posting about it on TikTok.

title: EU accuses Apple of breaking antitrust law over music streaming
description: European regulators have accused Apple of violating EU antitrust law, saying the company's app store rules unfairly restrict rival music services.

title: T-Pain laments missing hundreds of celeb DMs over two years
description: The list of people T-Pain needs to buy "a drank" just grew by quite a bit.

title: What the world's most expensive Irish whiskey tastes like
description: The second batch of Ireland's oldest ever whiskey collection will be released this May -- and a single bottle costs $45,000.

title: Nigerian teen gets 19 scholarship offers worth more than $5 million from the US and Canada
description: One Nigerian teenager must feel like she has the world at her feet after receiving 19 full-ride scholarship offers from universities across the United States and Canada.

title: Why Amazon is the 'perfect' moneymaking machine
description: Throughout the pandemic, Amazon has had no trouble generating huge returns. Once the Covid-19 crisis passes, it's in great shape to make even more money.

title: The Daily Beast: Gaetz associate wrote in letter that congressman paid for sex with minor
description: Joel Greenberg, a central figure in the ongoing investigation into Florida Republican Rep. Matt Gaetz, wrote in a letter obtained by The Daily Beast that he and Gaetz paid for sex with multiple women, including a minor who was 17 at the time.

title: First pregnant Egyptian mummy surprises researchers
description: An Egyptian mummy previously believed to be a priest has turned out to be a pregnant woman.

title: The past, present and future of space tourism
description: On April 30, 2001, US millionaire Dennis Tito arrived at the International Space Station (ISS) via a Russian Soyuz rocket, becoming the world's first space tourist.

title: Biden's economic push tests the power of pocketbook issues to sway America's polarized electorate
description: A building Biden boom may be about to reshape America's politics.

title: Social media footage shows stampede in Israel
description: Dozens of people have been killed in a crush at a mass religious gathering on Mount Meron in northern Israel, emergency responders say. CNN's Hadas Gold reports.

title: Former Germany defender Christoph Metzelder found guilty of sharing child pornography
description: Former Germany defender Christoph Metzelder was given a 10-month suspended prison sentence on Thursday after being found guilty of sharing pictures of child pornography with acquaintances through a message service, a court in Düsseldorf said.

title: He dreamed of climbing Mount Everest. But Covid-19 stopped him
description: Sources tell CNN there are now dozens of suspected cases of Covid-19 at the Everest Base Camp - although officials deny it. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout speaks to a Norwegian mountaineer who developed Covid-19 symptoms while climbing the mountain.

title: The great power race between the US and China is on. And Beijing is confident of winning
China orders Tencent and other big tech firms to curb their finance businesses
description: Chinese regulators have ordered more than a dozen tech companies to fix the most "prominent problems" of their financial units, escalating a historic crackdown on the sector that has already engulfed some of the country's top players.

title: Late-night hosts react to President Joe Biden's speech to Congress
description: Late-night hosts Jimmy Fallon, Seth Meyers and Stephen Colbert joke about President Joe Biden's first speech to Congress.

title: Top US, Japanese and South Korean military leaders meet, underscoring US shift from the Middle East to China
description: The top US general met his South Korean and Japanese counterparts in Hawaii Thursday, emphasizing America's commitment to "long-term peace and stability in the region" and underscoring a broader US shift from the Middle East to China.

title: Myanmar faces near total economic collapse as Covid and military coup wreak havoc
description: Almost half of Myanmar's population could be forced into poverty by the end of the year as the country teeters on the brink of economic collapse caused by the double shock of a bloody military coup and the Covid-19 pandemic, according to a new United Nations report.

title: 'I've never seen anything like this': Clarissa Ward on India Covid-19 crisis
description: In India, sick people are being turned away from hospitals that have run out of beds and oxygen, as the number of new coronavirus cases rise to record levels each day, creating a national crisis.

title: Taiwan's new coast guard flagship to counter China's 'gray zone' threat
description: Taiwan commissioned into service a new coast guard flagship Thursday to help counter China's "gray zone" war tactics against the island.

title: Why so many people in China are becoming mermaids
description: On a normal day, the Ambassador Lagoon inside China's Atlantis Sanya resort on the island of Hainan is home to about 86,000 marine creatures from over 280 animal species.

title: Germany to return looted Benin Bronzes to Nigeria
description: Precious artifacts that were looted during the colonial era will finally be returned to Nigeria, the German government has announced. The first returns are planned for 2022.

title: An anti-Trump Republican struggles to breakthrough in Texas
description: A special election in Texas' 6th district could be a test for the future of the Republican party, where Republican Michael Wood is running on an anti-Trump message.

title: Giuliani speaks out about FBI raid
description: Anderson Cooper, Maggie Haberman of the New York Times, and former FBI Deputy Director Andrew McCabe discuss the raid at the residence and office of former Donald Trump attorney Rudy Giuliani.

title: DC Police personnel files obtained by hackers in recent ransomware attack, acting police chief says
description: The personnel files of some Washington Metropolitan Police Department officers were obtained by hackers in a ransomware attack earlier this month, the department's acting police chief said Thursday.
